column2: He looked around the carriage he was sitting in. It was full of night people, waiters, nurses, party returners, drunksâ€”even a traffic warden. The train eventually pulled into his station at twelve-forty.
It was the opinion of the forensic pathologist who saw the body at twelve-forty that Mrs. O'Keefe had died very shortly after her return home.
Twenty minutes to one? exclaimed Helen. "My mother will certainly think we're lost. But I hate to go. It is magnificent, even if it is terrible."
